column4: can anyone guess why i can't open /sys/devices/temperature/<insert file here> , i get an error saying the file does not exist but the thumbnail in nautilus shows different text for each. and i am doing so as root, via both gedit and vi
jordan_u: with gksudo gedit or vi in term as root
jordan_u: yep, they all exist, permissions say i should be able to read/write
Why do you want to open them in a text editor?
jordan_u: do adjust my minimum temp before the fan comes on
jordan_u: i am using a ppc and it gets a bit warm, in an unusual way
probably, i just thought it a little funny
jordan_u: ok, i'll give it a shot
jordan_u: now if it helps keep it cool... lol
Np, by the way the problem is most likely that text editors usually save to a temporary file then rename it over the old one. Since /sys is not a normal file system this doesn't work
